title: At the European Parliament, the French far right has deliberately done nothing
summary: For five years, almost all of the Rassemblement National's members of the European Parliament have shunned responsibilities. They are described as lacking the will and skills, but it is also a part of their political strategy.

title: China's Xi arrives in France for Macron talks on Ukraine
summary: Chinese President Xi Jinping has begun his carefully planned tour of Europe, where he will visit France, Serbia and Hungary to discuss Beijing's relations with Moscow.

title: Israel closes Kerem Shalom crossing after rocket fire as latest Cairo talks end
summary: Israel warned of a military operation in the 'near future' after it closed the aid crossing point following what it says was a Hamas attack.

title: Ukraine marks its third Easter at war under fire from Russian drones
summary: The shadow of Russia's invasion of Ukraine hung over the country as Volodymyr Zelensky marked the holiday, telling Ukrainians that God was their 'ally.'

title: Madonna puts on biggest-ever concert for free on Brazil's Copacabana beach
summary: An estimated 1.5 million people attended the last show of The Celebration Tour on Saturday, which kicked off in October 2023 in London.

title: Keeping the Olympic flame alive aboard the 'Belem'
summary: Three sailors take continuous turns on the French boat to ensure that the sacred fire, protected inside a lantern, is never extinguished, in accordance with the strict protocol.

title: Paris 2024: Students left unsure of their fate after agency requisitions accommodation for Olympic Games
summary: By mid-April only around 100 students had been rehoused out of over 1,400 applications.

title: Fashion finds firm footing in Marseille
summary: With a museum, a festival, schools and young designers, a wind of fashion has been blowing through Marseille for the past 10 years.

title: The complex issue of looted Chinese art restitution
summary: As Chinese President Xi Jinping visits France to mark 60 years of diplomatic relations between the two countries, Le Monde takes a look back at the fate of objects stolen from Beijing by French troops during the sack of the Summer Palace in 1860.

title: Israel orders Al Jazeera to close its Jerusalem office, seizes equipment
summary: Al Jazeera's office in Jerusalem was raided on Sunday after Benjamin Netanyahu's government voted to shut down its operations in the country.

title: England's Conservatives crushed by Labour in local elections
summary: Ahead of parliamentary elections due to take place before the end of 2024, the Tories lost almost 500 seats across England and Wales in a crushing defeat marking the return of Labour's popularity.

title: Israeli military accused of torturing Palestinian inmates
summary: At least 40 Palestinians from the enclave are reported to have died while in the custody of the Israeli army.

title: Russell 'Texas' Bentley: The life and death of an American from Donetsk
summary: Based in eastern Ukraine's Donbas region since 2014, 'Texas' committed himself body and soul to the pro-Russian side. He was likely killed by Russian soldiers who mistook him for a spy.

title: Palestinian doctor Ghassan Abu-Sittah denied entry into France
summary: Doctor Abu-Sittah, who worked for a month and a half in the Palestinian enclave at the start of the war, was turned away on arrival at Paris' Charles-de-Gaulle airport on Saturday.

title: France: Macron says a 'proportional aspect' in legislative elections 'would be good for democracy'
summary: In an interview with dailies 'La Provence' and 'La Tribune Dimanche' on French political institutions, the president said he thinks it's 'always better to leave the choice to voters.'

title: Biden in search of an elusive peace on US campuses and in Gaza
summary: Denounced by progressive youth for his policy of support for Israel and accused by the Republican right of allowing chaos in universities to flourish, the US president is in a delicate political situation.

title: 'Lord of the Rings' actor Bernard Hill dies aged 79
summary: Known for roles in 'Titanic' and 'The Lord of the Rings' trilogy, the actor's death on Sunday was confirmed by his agent.

title: Mona Lisa: Painting should be separated 'to save other works polluted by overtourism'
summary: The museum's management wants to isolate the 'Mona Lisa' in a room with its own entrance, which could help rid the painting of overtourism, says Michel Guerrin, editor-in-chief of Le Monde.

title: Ukraine, trade to dominate discussions during Xi Jinping's visit to Europe
summary: The Chinese President will visit France, then Serbia and Hungary. He is expected to encourage Europeans to distance themselves from Washington.

title: Rescue effort continues as death toll in Brazil floods climbs to 78
summary: At least 150,000 people have been forced to flee their homes, with more than 3,000 rescue personnel on the scene still trying to reach trapped residents.

title: Kenya's 'Wild West' of pesticides
summary: Fruits and vegetables destined for the domestic market are highly vulnerable, while those intended for export are much more strictly regulated.

title: Thousands rally for trans rights in France after Senate report
summary: Trans rights group say the report by right-wing Senators would allow for a return to 'conversion therapy'.

title: Georgian youth lead protests against 'foreign influence' law: 'We'll keep going until the law is withdrawn, we're not afraid!'
summary: Demonstrators marched again on Friday in opposition to the Russian-inspired legal bill requiring independent media and NGOs to register if they receive more than 20% of their funding from abroad.

title: José Raul Mulino wins Panama presidential race
summary: The replacement for former president Ricardo Martinelli, convicted of money laundering, won the presidential election by a wide margin on Sunday.

title: Israel army evacuates 100,000 Rafah residents ahead of expected ground assault
summary: The Israeli army said on Monday it 'encourages' the residents to move to an 'expanded humanitarian area' in the Palestinian territory.

title: Sweden's social model is on its last legs
summary: In schools, hospitals and nursing homes, employees complain of worsening working conditions. Meanwhile new budget cuts are being announced by local and regional authorities, whose deficits are exploding.

title: The first time Le Monde wrote Aya Nakamura
summary: At the end of April, the French-Malian singer was awarded three prizes at the Flammes music awards. Her name first appeared in an online article in Le Monde on August 25, 2017, upon the release of her debut album.

title: Gaza protests at Sciences Po: 'This could all go up in flames if there's no dialogue'
summary: French political scientist and emeritus professor at Sciences Po Bertrand Badie says that the students protesting in support of Palestinians is a symbol of the 'globalized youth' in touch with the world, involving more of an 'identification' than an 'allegiance,' in an interview with Le Monde.

title: Elie Barnavi, former Israeli diplomat: 'Recognize a Palestinian state, now'
summary: The former diplomat argues that Israel's allies must act now and recognize a Palestinian state after the US voted against admitting the State of Palestine to the UN on April 18.

title: France and China share sixty years of tumultuous and unbalanced diplomatic relations
summary: President Emmanuel Macron welcomes his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping for a state visit on May 6 and 7. It's an opportunity for Paris and Beijing to celebrate a highly political relationship and one that is increasingly tilting in China's favor.

title: Chad wakes up to uncertain presidential election
summary: Mahamat Idriss Déby, who took over as transitional president after the death of his father in 2021, faces the prime minister, Succès Masra, in the vote on Monday.

title: EU to drop rule-of-law proceedings against Poland
summary: The EU and Poland had been at odds after the Law and Justice party came to power in 2015.

title: A mysterious €21 billion hole in France's coffers
summary: Was it a forecasting error or the inevitable consequence of tax cuts? Le Monde journalist Elsa Conesa writes about the controversy behind the size of France's public deficit.

title: How Dubai became a safe haven for drug traffickers
summary: Overdose. France under the influence | Part 6. A paradise for opaque finances and a mecca for those with money to burn, the Emirate has everything it takes to please high-level drug traffickers, who flock there to put their feet up.

title: Columbia University cancels graduation ceremony due to Gaza protests
summary: The university, which has been rocked by pro-Palestinian student protests against Israel's actions in Gaza, has stressed in its announcement that its decision to focus on 'smaller-scale, school-based celebrations' was 'based on feedback from our students.'

title: Macron and von der Leyen press China's Xi on Ukraine and fair trade at Paris summit
summary: The French and EU Commission Presidents spoke to Chinese President Xi Jinping in a trilateral meeting, kicking off Xi's two-day state visit to France with discussions of 'fair rules for all' in trade, as well as China's exports to Russia during its war in Ukraine.

title: Voter in Chad election shot dead at polling station
summary: According to Chadian election officials and local authorities, a gunman who did not have a voter card 'burst into the voting station' and, on being barred from voting, 'drew his weapon and fired' indiscriminately, killing a 65-year-old voter.

title: Japan defends its immigration policy, amid Joe Biden's accusations of xenophobia
summary: Despite its declining population and a severe labor shortage, the country has maintained strict criteria for foreigners entering its territory.

title: Putin orders nuclear drills with troops near Ukraine
summary: The Russian leader made the decision in the face of Western 'threats,' as a Ukrainian drone attack killed six people and wounded over 30 in Russia's Belgorod border region.

title: US Senator Bernie Sanders is running for reelection
summary: The 82-year-old liberal politican from Vermont is seeking a fourth term. He highlighted threats to democracy, wealth inequality and the Israel-Hamas war in his announcement video.

title: Trump fined and threatened with jail for gag order violations
summary: Judge Juan Merchan threatened Donald Trump, the Republican party candidate for the US presidential election with 'incarceration' if he reoffends, during his New York criminal trial for hush money payments made to former adult film star Stormy Daniels.
